text:
Jof Davies regularly directs and engineers multicamera livestreams for MTDCNC. Responsibilities span technical setup, operation, and live fault management.

Core competencies include:
- Operation of BMPCC, Sony, and Panasonic cameras.
- Switching and routing using ATEM hardware and vMix.
- Networked video transport with NDI, SDI, RTMP-mini servers, and SRT.
- Wireless AV systems including Hollyland, LiveU, Teradek, and Vaxis.
- Remote guest management and two-way communication using vMix Call.
- Complete control of talkback, monitoring, audio mix, levels, and redundancy.

Jof covers every technical role except presenting: director, operator, camera, audio, encoder, and systems engineer. Livestreams often involve receiving signals from multiple countries, routing them into a unified show structure, and broadcasting to MTDCNC channels.
